channel.title: CVE Feed for Apache Software Foundation -- Apache Tika
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Apache Software Foundation -- Apache Tika

item.title: CVE-2018-1338|2024-08-05T03:59:38.597Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20tika
item.description: A carefully crafted (or fuzzed) file can trigger an infinite loop in Apache Tika's BPGParser in versions of Apache Tika before 1.18.

item.title: CVE-2018-1339|2024-08-05T03:59:38.420Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20tika
item.description: A carefully crafted (or fuzzed) file can trigger an infinite loop in Apache Tika's ChmParser in versions of Apache Tika before 1.18.

item.title: CVE-2018-8017|2024-08-05T06:46:11.463Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20tika
item.description: In Apache Tika 1.2 to 1.18, a carefully crafted file can trigger an infinite loop in the IptcAnpaParser.

item.title: CVE-2018-1335|2024-08-05T03:59:38.573Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20tika
item.description: From Apache Tika versions 1.7 to 1.17, clients could send carefully crafted headers to tika-server that could be used to inject commands into the command line of the server running tika-server. This vulnerability only affects those running tika-server on a server that is open to untrusted clients. The mitigation is to upgrade to Tika 1.18.
